name: Kale Salad with Cajun Spiced Chickpeas and Buttermilk Dressing
description: This kale salad is spiked with cajun spiced chickpeas, a tangy homemade buttermilk dressing, slivers of red onion, and a light dusting of Parmesan cheese.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the dressing first, so the flavors have time to blend. In a medium bowl, whisk together the buttermilk dressing ingredients (buttermilk, mayonnaise, lemon juice, salt, garlic powder, oregano, and about 10-15 cranks of a pepper mill). Taste the dressing and add more salt if desired. Refrigerate the dressing until ready to use.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare the dressing first, so the flavors have time to blend. In a medium bowl, whisk together the buttermilk dressing ingredients (buttermilk, mayonnaise, lemon juice, salt, garlic powder, oregano, and about 10-15 cranks of a pepper mill). Taste the dressing and add more salt if desired. Refrigerate the dressing until ready to use.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the chickpeas in a colander and rinse with cool water. Add the olive oil to a non-stick skillet and place over a medium flame. Add the drained chickpeas along with the salt, smoked paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, cayenne, thyme, and another 10-15 cranks of a pepper mill. Sauté the chickpeas and spices for about five minutes, or until the chickpeas are slightly toasted. Remove from the heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the chickpeas in a colander and rinse with cool water. Add the olive oil to a non-stick skillet and place over a medium flame. Add the drained chickpeas along with the salt, smoked paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, cayenne, thyme, and another 10-15 cranks of a pepper mill. Sauté the chickpeas and spices for about five minutes, or until the chickpeas are slightly toasted. Remove from the heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the stems from the kale, then slice the kale leaves into thin strips (see step by step photos below for more detail). Rinse the kale with cool water and allow the excess water to drain away. Thinly slice the red onion.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the stems from the kale, then slice the kale leaves into thin strips (see step by step photos below for more detail). Rinse the kale with cool water and allow the excess water to drain away. Thinly slice the red onion.

recipeInstructions.text: To build the salad, place the washed kale in a large bowl (or four serving bowls), add the spiced chickpeas, a few slices of red onion, and a light dusting of Parmesan (about 1 tsp per serving). Finally, taste the buttermilk dressing after it has had time to refrigerate and adjust the salt if needed. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and then serve.
recipeInstructions.name: To build the salad, place the washed kale in a large bowl (or four serving bowls), add the spiced chickpeas, a few slices of red onion, and a light dusting of Parmesan (about 1 tsp per serving). Finally, taste the buttermilk dressing after it has had time to refrigerate and adjust the salt if needed. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and then serve.

review.reviewBody: I made it exactly as the recipe says, except I forgot the Parmesan. Then, at the last minute, I had some leftover rice, so I mixed that in, and added a little extra dressing to make it more of a "main dish." My husband is not a kale fan, and at first, didn't believe that it was kale. He said that it was the most delicious kale dish he'd ever eaten. I am a huge kale fan, and I thought it was fantastic. I'm going to double the dressing recipe next time, and serve it on everything.

Very delicious salad with lots of enjoyable flavors and textures. More filling than I thought it would be too. I always have extra buttermilk on hand when bake something with it, so it was a perfect opportunity to keep it from going to waste! Thanks for another awesome and inexpensive recipe!
AMAZING. I ate this for lunch and dinner yesterday. This buttermilk dressing is sooo good, and I am always looking for new ways to cook lacinato/dino kale!

This was a great dinner for me. I am trying to eat more healthfully (is there anyone who isn't?). I would definitely make this again and feed it to other people who like kale too. I agree with you about the lacinato kale versus the curly kale. Thanks for a wonderful recipe!
One of my all time favorite salads..I ended up roasting the chickpeas in the oven this time to get them a little more crunchy, but this recipe is just spot on..hearty, healthy, DELICIOUS!!
I LOVE this buttermilk dressing! I also can't get enough of those toasted chickpeas. What a great meal, thanks Beth!

I tried this with some romaine and it was amazing! The spices were delicious and the dressing made me want to (and maybe did) lick the plate. You could not have posted this recipe at a better time. The bank account is getting low but I had everything already in my kitchen or the community garden. Thank you!

I made this tonight and loved it!  Added some grilled chicken.  The flavors melded together perfect and the spicy toasted chickpeas were nice and crunchy.   We ate it as a main course.  

I added all of the dressing at once and tossed it which I wouldn't recommend because it was heavily dressed, ended up adding extra kale and random lettuce.

Will DEFINTELY make this again, please do more salad recipes!
This salad looks great, I'll definitely be copying the cajun spiced chickpeas!
